description: Came here for the second time within 3 months and had the Tuna Salad in Whole Wheat, and it was good. Enjoyed the ambience and customer service! Will be back!!!
author: Sergey S.

description: This is a little local gem. Quiet. Small. Great coffee. The service staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. If you are in the area, stop by!
author: James S.

description:
I love this place so much, it was closed for a bit due to a fire but now it's open, I love every single thing about this little cafe, nice decoration, a fair variety of baked goods and some breakfast burritos, they also have some good packaged drinks and a variety of protein bars.
Great for studying also, finals are coming up so this is a good place to get prepared at.
author: Celeste G.

description: This is my absolute FAVORITE coffee shop in San Francisco. The vibe is perfect for relaxing or being productive. I love the playlist and I visit often. The Wi-Fi is super fast and there are plenty of places to plug in.  On top of that there's a great food selection and delicious coffee. I love coming here because there's always a cozy place to sit and Tammy and her Mom take amazing care of their customers. I highly recommend this spot to anyone and everyone, and I'd happily give it more then five stars if I could. Come check it out!
author: Sarah B.

description: Updated review. This place was sold a few months ago. The new owners are a really nice family. Zombie girl, who used to work here, is gone. Often at the counter is either mom or the daughter, who is a really delightful young woman. The coffee is good and not overpriced. The wi-fi is reliable, and their sandwiches are decent. I come by some afternoons to kick it and do a little work or reading. The only negative is that on hot, sunny days it can be kind of "roasty" inside.
author: Baba D.

description: Great coffee and bagel shop. Had one of their ham and cheese croissant and it was really good. I will try their pastrami sandwich next time for lunch. Quick service and clean.
author: Andy C.

description:
I have been so happy with Luv a Java and knowing what to expect with my coffee and food there. I have been treated well by the owners Fahed and Sam. I know that Tammy will also make sure of that in the future. Thank You Sam and Fahed. Welcome Tammy and family. 

Love the quiet calm atmosphere.
author: Jeanne J.

description: Ordered an Iced coffee with hazelnut and vanilla soooo yummy they adjusted to my level of desired sweetness, asiago and cream cheese bagel (totally not skimpy on the cream cheese) toasted just right. I love this cozy cafe, owner so friendly!! Could sit n people watch while I work, corner location with bright big windows . Cute community bookshelf where u can take, return books as you please. Such a gem to have in the neighborhood.
author: Joy T.

description: Beautifully located coffee shop nestled on the hills of Dolores, wonderful coffee, fast internet ,and the most amazing and loving service from Tammy xoxo! Will start to work my mornings from here! Highly recommended++
author: Omar S.

description:
I absolutely love this community coffee shop, it's a total neighborhood jem. Sam & Fahad (the owners) are so friendly and know our orders by heart (because they are so nice, they hired a pretty unfriendly woman who really needed a job, but she's gone now and it's back to 5 stars all around!).

Coffee is $2 and strong and delicious, which is a great value esp in this city (though I wear plaid and bike to work, I don't really ever want a $4 pour over!). They do have cappuccinos and chais and their egg sandwiches on a bagel are the best I've found in the city (I'm from NY and good bagels are tough to find out here!).

I "work from home" here at least once a week - wifi is super fast, plugs conveniently located and they are totally cool with me staying all day (I usually order 1 drink and 1 food item). I also like that you see a mix of people - there will be older men reading the Times in one corner, a ladies book club talking about social justice in another, families speaking arabic on the couch, and some of us on computers, which is a great vibe. I also left my computer charger here one day and a week later they gave it back to me in a bag w/ my name on it (so so nice thoughtful!).

It's also kid friendly! On the weekends I bring my 1 year old and no one seems to mind when he's running all over the place. There is a little kid table with some books (they are old, but my kid doesn't seem to care).
author: Sarah G.

description: Small cute coffee shop that my girlfriend and I go to maybe twice a week. Love the service, and really want to support them!
author: Richard K.

description: they close at 1330 on sat. I found the little coffee shop while waiting for one of my friends...decided to have a small cup of coffee...no sugar or cream. the brew was nice and smooth. not burnt. simple.
author: Raquel K.

description:
Nice spot but terrible, rude employee in the afternoons. Walked in at 3:30 and was told she was closing. "What time do you close?" 
"4 pm".  Got a tea to go. She needs to move on.
author: Don D.

description:
Strange place with weird hours, unfriendly afternoon staff and quite possibly the worst
mocha ever guarantees no return business from me. Too bad - decent looking cafe in
a good location that has lots of potential but lacks the basics regarding how to provide 
customer service.
author: Richard B.

description:
Yelp Review

1. Staff Friendliness: 5
2. Staff Knowledge: 5
3. Staff Efficiency: 5
4. Transaction Time: 5
5. Order Wait Time: 5
6. Register Counter Cleanliness: 4
7. Kitchen / Prep Area Cleanliness: 3
8. Dining Area Cleanliness: 4
9. Resroom Cleanliness: N/A
10. Storefront Cleanliness: 5
11. Food Handling (i.e. clean hands): 5
12. Food/Drink Presentation (i.e. wrapping, boxing, pouring): 3
13. Food/Drink Preparation (i.e. made with care): 4
14. Food/Drink Value: (i.e. worth the price): 2 
15. Food/Drink Taste: 2

(Total score) / (Questions Answered)  = (Yelp!)
author: Charlie A.

description: Nice authentic place with out the typical SF markup. Great sandwiches and great service.  And they're open early! I don't drink coffee so I can't speak to that. They also have wifi.
author: Syd S.

description: Just had a white mocha from this cute place. It was so creamy and delicious! The man behind the counter was so friendly and cool.
author: J.J. P.

description: This place has recently undergone some upgrades and it looks great! The fresh paint, the new menus, and the lightning fast Wifi make this a great place to sit and enjoy the morning or get some work done. The service is excellent, the coffee is prepared well, and the food is delicious and made fresh to order.
author: Tyler M.

description: Love this place! It is a laid back coffee shop with great service and always room to sit (a true rarity for SF). The people who work here are always super nice. Just a wonderful neighborhood spot. The hot pastrami sandwich is my favorite!
author: F H.

description: It was peaceful and quiet!  We sat and worked for hours on our computers while enjoying drinks and food.
author: Blaine B.

description:
Open early on a Sunday morning, we stopped by Luv a Java to grab some lattes before hitting the road

Medium (16 oz) - 3 shots - $3.50.  Mediums are usually 2 shots so if you're a 3-shot girl like me, you know you're going to need that extra

Very strong taste & the milk wasn't as creamy as other places we've been to but it wasn't to the point I needed to add any sugar.  Overall have to say it was an A-OK latte

Lemon Cake for the BF - said it was very lemonny & good (I don't do citrus in my food)

He had originally tried for a piece of Pumpkin Cake but it had mold on it - but hey, it can happen

We'd come back & try again
author: Adrienne G.

description: I was looking for a place to study on a Sunday afternoon and needed a quick pick-me-up as well. Luv a Java was exactly what I was looking for - quiet cafe, lots of open tables, great afternoon natural lighting, plenty of outlets, and easy parking. I ordered an unsweetened Chai Latte (~$3) which was pretty good and was what I needed to continue trekking through my work. Next time I'm home and I need to get some work done, I'll definitely drop by Luv a Java again.
author: Elaine N.

description: It's an ok place. Cozy and convenient location but nothing about the coffee or the food really stands out
author: Samir K.

description:
This is a fantastic little coffee shop! To be honest it is probably one of the best coffee shops that I have been to in a long time. Luv a Java? Why,  yes I do!  
Their coffee is delicious and I have not had a tastier mocha anywhere and their gluten free sandwich options are awesome! I'm sure that their regular sandwiches are just as good. The staff is super friendly and they will happily customize whatever you want (I.e. gluten free sandwiches). If you are in the area, I could not recommend this place more!
author: Ian C.

description: Apparently they are only open until 2:30 on Mondays? Heard the employee telling a customer they try to close by 4 weekdays and 3 on weekends.. Pretty sure the reason he asked what time they close was because of how clearly un pleased she was by him coming in and ordering something around 2:15. I got the same reaction placing my order in at around 2. Maybe change your times on google and Yelp to help prevent this from happening more in the future? Oh and maybe tell your employee to smile and welcome customers into your business rather than glare at us and make us feel very unwelcome. A simple smile goes a long way, especially in the customer service industry.. $$$ Other than that, food was good, nothing special, prices were average, would possibly return
author: Kate N.

description: Cute coffee shop right on the corner of Delores.  My vanilla latte was not that great.  It could have been stronger in taste.  The service was okay.
author: Liz D.

description:
Bad coffee and worse service - no reason to go here when there are so many better options nearby. 

We had a macchiato and and almond milk latte and both were undrinkable.
author: Orla M.

description: Great little coffee shop to hang out, grab a bite and do some work (or goof off). Wifi and outlets a plenty. I went on a Saturday afternoon for a few hours and pretty much had the run of the place. The barista was friendly, and you could tell the shop is a local Noe favorite since she knew half the people that came in! I scored a free refill on my coffee, which always makes my day, and the breakfast bagel sandwich was delish.
author: Olivia S.

description:
Best (unsweetened) chai latte in town!!! Period.

It's so rare that I come across chai latte that isn't already pre-sweetened and they make the chai without any sugar or honey. You can always add it later if you want to. 

The cafe is spacious with about 10 tables, but it's never crowded since it's at a relatively residential corner of 26th & Dolores. They have real food like bagels and sandwiches, too. They also seem to have a "mini library" going on here where you can borrow or exchange books, seems kinda cool. I like to come here and work on my laptop. Staff is always friendly and helpful.

Pros:
 --- seating pretty much always available
 --- good drinks (get the chai latte!) and real hot food
 --- speedy, reliable wifi
 --- power outlets

Cons:
 --- closes at 5PM
author: Elizabeth T.

description: I've stopped in here periodically over the past three years. The staff is friendly, the coffee is good and the food offerings are often stale. Stay away from the sausage though, it's pretty disgusting.
author: Shawn C.

description: The appeal of independent local coffee shops is usually a combination of good/great coffee and great/friendly service. This place has neither. Mediocre coffee would've been okay, but the service is terrible and extremely unfriendly.
author: Christian H.

description:
Had a really great experience here yesterday. Was just grabbing a bagel, and ran into the most pleasant employee (I didn't get her name, I wish I did) who knocked a buck off the veggie bagel after I told her to nix the avocado due to one of my weird allergies. 
Anyway, super cute little coffee shop, great vibe and personalized service. Love it. Definitely will go back when I need some quiet time with my laptop and and a good cup of coffee.
Side note: also seemed like patrons were drinking coffee out of all different cute, quirky coffee cups, no cookie cutter cups on paper (that I saw). If I did really see that and it wasn't just two dudes who happened to bring their own coffee cups that day, extra stars. It's the little things.
author: Mia B.

description:
We stopped by on a whim because we were in the mood for some espresso and the cafe happened to be at the corner when we got the craving. We had a pooch in tow so I didn't get to check out the interior much however, props for Luv a Java for having a menu which I could read from the entrance!

No table outside, but they do have a bench for which two people are able to sit and enjoy coffee. 

Let me tell you, if I ever have a craving at this corner again I will be back!
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Great little spot! This has become my go-to local indie coffee shop. It has that typical funky vibe that most indie coffee shops have - displaying local artists' work - but also caters to the family crowd  with a tiny table meant for the little ones. (It IS in Noe Valley after all.)  That said, there's only been one occasion when I've found it difficult to focus because of some rambunctious tots. Otherwise, the place is generally an ideal spot to work.

As for food and drink: I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but I can vouch for the breakfast sandwiches. Having just arrived from the east coast, I must say it is SUCH a welcome change to find that spots like this are able to load on fresh produce ingredients. So it probably goes without saying they have tons of veggie options too, but I think they're worth mentioning.  Like the Sun-Dried Tomato Bagel for instance.(It's exactly what it sounds like + red onions and cream cheese). Or the Veggie Bagel (cream cheese, cucumber, tomato, red onions, and avocado), and the Veggie Garden Sandwich (hummus, cheese, avocado, sprouts, lettuce, tomato, red onions, and jalpeno). 

With this place in my 'hood, I run the risk of never making myself breakfast again. Yum!
author: Anne D.

description:
Great neighborhood cafe...and free wi-fi!  

I used my yelp app to find me a cafe near my location and this is what came up.  I'm a big fan of neighborhood cafes and this one fits this particular area of Noe Valley.  The cafe is right on the corner of Dolores and 26th so it was easy to get to.  

The gal who helped me today was courteous and had a good rapport with those coming into the cafe.  There were even regulars who asked if she was new, but apparently had worked at this cafe before and just returned.  

There are a variety of coffee choices, sandwiches, bagels, Pleasant Pies, other pastries,  cold drinks, chips, even Kale Chips for those of you who are into that. =).

It helped that this place has free wi-fi so I was able to hang out and enjoy my Lox bagel & Vanilla Latte while surfing the web and getting some tasks done.
author: Caroline A.

description: This is your next door coffee shop with a homely feel - relaxed and chill. Good coffee and snacks - Super fast internet and good place to get some work done every once in a while.
author: Sachin G.

description:
My mocha was actually really good...but this place gets only 3 stars because of the woman working behind the counter today, July 1, 2012.

She was really rude and off-putting. (She made me feel like I asked a stupid question by asking if they do espresso shots, when I have been to plenty of other coffee places that don't have those as an option. She looked at me and sarcastically said something like "Of course, how else would I make it???")

Then, sadly, she was just as rude to the nice older lady that was behind me in line. Even my boyfriend, who was on his phone and didn't order anything, noted how rude she'd been to me and the other customer.

Won't be going back to this place as long as Ms. Rudeness works there.
author: Austin C.

description:
Wifi.  Beverages.  Tables.  Generally Quiet. Good natural light. It's good.  The drip coffee is kinda...well...not worth talking any more about.  Bagels are ok.   

Get some coffee and food and sit and work here...not too bad.  Ask the barista for the wifi password.
author: David S.

description: Would of been a five star but the fact they have certain things on the menu that they no longer serve.. They use to make blended cold drinks but all of a sudden stopped making them.. I use to order the blended mocha all the time til they told me they no longer make it and will take it off the board which was over a year ago.. yet it is still up there.. other than that this place and calm and peaceful.. free wifi & chill.
author: Illa C V.

description:
I go to this place nearly everyday and I love it.  The coffee is fantastic and I like the food.  In fact, when they see me coming they just grab my favorite green/blue mug and have it ready for me.  

There are lots of laptop users and people love to get on their cell phone and have loud conversations which I found annoying. Why should I have to listen to your virtual "sales call?" (which is 90 of the calls people make). 

If I want to get on my phone, I take it outside .. lo and behold, people upon seeing me do this, have started taking their calls outside. What an interesting anthropological observation!  I'm thrilled that the patrons have started to do this.

This is one of Noe Valley's treasures.
author: Richard F.

description: Good coffee. Spacious. Ham sandwich the biggest I've ever been served in a city and way underpriced. Quiet and non-touristy. Top-notch.
author: luke w.

description: Quite Noe Valley place to study. Lots of baked goods and things to eat. Coffee is bleh. Free wifi. Good spot.
author: Will D.

description: One of the few places that offers a absolutely-not-sweet spicy chai latte, just the way I like it. They offer the normal sweet one and a mixed version as well if you're into sugar. They have a good variety of teas and gorgeous handmade mugs if you're staying awhile. My go-to, quiet, relaxed, computer-friendly cafe.
author: K D.

description: This place makes me feel comfortable.  I don't usually hang at cafes but this place is exceptional.  They plenty of seatings and free WiFi. The price is reasonable and the music isn't ungodly loud. The staff was very nice. And its right in a very quiet part of Dolores street.
author: Sutheerawan A.

description:
The atmosphere of Luv a Java is more conducive to work than play.  It's off the beaten path, so to speak, so you shouldn't find a hard time finding a place to take root.  (I like the couch, myself.)  The staff here is friendly, and the coffee is just right.  

Note:  The bathroom is tiny!  It reminds one of an airplane lavatory (except this one is clean).
author: Marsha Z.

description: Varieties of Sweets and Drink selection. Lightly sounded music will let you concentrate on your studying or reading, and will make you more creative. I always wanted to go here, so I feel so happy I finally stopped by. There is one more good thing about this place. Talking to a friendly and nice owner Sam will make your day for sure:)
author: Maitai N.

description:
What a cool spot! 

You must check out the bathroom with a door to the outside. I want one. 

Free WIFI, bagel sandwiches, clean and cute. Coffee was not bad. 

I'll be back for sure!
author: Molly G.

description:
My home away from home!

The perfect neighborhood shop to relax, work, nourish, and enjoy what living in San Francisco has come to mean to me.

The staff are the friendliest and amazing at remembering what my (and my family's) favorite things are to eat and drink. In the morning, I stumble into the shop - more like sleep walking - and J knows exactly what I need. Her greeting, smile and perfect mocha (or chai tea) makes for the start of a perfect day! 

Thank you for being my home and workplace!
author: J S.

description:
I felt like I was at someone's house having coffee.  Somebody I liked.  This is good.

Luv a Java is a sleepy coffee shop that (before my troop of gorillas and my monkey arse marched in) was as quiet as a library.  You'll find bookish people doing bookish things in a snug, unpretentious lounge.  The coffee's excellent, they serve hot food, and there's free WiFi as well as a pay-per-use computer station.  

You'll fit right at home the moment you walk in -- a lovely alternative to the noisier, faster Starbucks bustle.   Their barista is also teh' hotness.

Weird observation -- Whomever put the bathroom together was a clever hack.  One of the walls seems to be a functioning restrained door.  The tiny stall must also have a 20 foot tall clearance so it feels like you're inside some kind of rustic potty silo.  I was amused.
author: niero g.

description: This place is like going to see my family..I love them there, very friendly.. The best Kale Chips this side of the mississippi...Kale Mary Full of Taste....http://blog.sfgate.com/cityexposed/2013/05/25/kale-mary-finds-finds-saving-grace/#12628-3
author: Lisa L.

description:
A cute neighborhood cafe.  Unpretentious, free wifi, chill and good coffee.  You cant ask for too much more than that. 

Staff always seem super nice and I never leave thinking it was super expensive
author: ORLA L.

description: Mmmmmm, that's a good mocha with friendly staff :)
author: Kyle S.

description:
Another small, charming café tucked away in the Noe Valley. Quiet, good vibes, simple, elegant deco, lots of natural light. Tiny bathroom. A wooden book shelf at the corner. A cool place to be alone and read a book undisturbed, in solitude. 

It serves the BEST cappuccino I have ever had! Wonderful white froth and great taste. Magical... Try it!
author: Rachel W.

description: Quaint little cafe. Free wifi, good selection of bagels muffins and sandwiches, good coffee. Not super cheap but still affordable. ($7.50 for a ham and cheese muffin which was super yummy, and large cappuccino). I would have given 5 stars except, the door was left open at all times so the place was FREEZING. Secondly, there was one service staff in particular (lady with black hair and large earrings) was not very friendly at all. (The rest of the staff were great!) I sure hope she was just having a bad day, because otherwise this is a great place.
author: Aileen S.

description:
I love this place.

I travel to SF often from LA, and stay at my friend's place just down the street.  Luv a Java has become such a mainstay in my SF life.  The coffee's great, the food's good, the baristas are always pleasant and helpful. 

Noe Valley is lucky to have Luv a Java.
author: Syd p.

description:
So far I am a fan!

This place is only a block away, small and cute, and the mocha is pretty good! I have yet to try other things. 

I've finally found a neighborhood cafe to replace my old one.
author: Miss C.

description:
Luv a Java may be what I miss most about San Francisco.  Having moved far far away, I was initially forced to smuggle their signature blend coffee half way across the country.  Now, I've worked out a deal with their supplier.  It sure sounds like contraband, but when the coffee is THIS good, you do what it takes.

I MISS YOU GUYS!
author: Michael M.

description: I think I come here once every other week. All is usually fine. The people who work there are always nice. I do have one concern about the milk steaming machine though - perhaps it's because I come in so early in the morning but sometimes my froth smells a little like bleach. Today my stomach hurt after a few sips. Perhaps they can just work on number of times they rinse the machine before starting to steam the milk?  Anyway, still a nice place to go, very clean and the coffee, chai and snacks are quite good. Maybe I've just been going in really early and the machines are still fresh from cleaning.
author: Sari S.

description:
Rocks! I have just  seamlessly spent the whole day sitting on the cafe's couch, doing computer work, eating a veggie bagel, a chocolate croissant,  coffee, and orange juice.

The cafe is in a very friendly neighborhood which is reflected in the cafe itself.
author: xavier v.

description:
I am a no-good down-low traitor to my hood. Tho I lived for 2 years on 19th and Dolores, literally half-a-cigarette's walk from Dolores Coffeeshop, Luv a Java is where I spent my money and my time. Laid-back isn't quite the term for it. It's more like getting a great cup of coffee and some killer banana bread for $3.50 total delivered to you in your tastefully-appointed and super-comfortable study. 

And somehow, the sun always manages to find its way thru the SF clouds to shine here.
author: Brock D.

description:
While taking a brisk walk through my neighborhood, I thought I'd check out a new coffee house experience - Luv a Java. Since the shop is in more of the neighborhoody part of Mission/Noe, I had not come upon it before. The atmosphere, food, and beverage was more than just bland. 

The place was quiet even though most of the tables were filled. When I said hello to the cashier upon stepping up to the counter, everyone in the shop turned like I had sneezed in a monastery. 

The manager or owner type felt the need to ask everyone in the shop if they had ordered my sandwich, even though the cashier had asked for my name, saying that he thought my order was weird. The order - turkey, hummus, cucumber on plain bagel. This guy made the order weird & me sick from it - he heated the hummus! Gross! 

And my chai tea was luke warm with milk concentrated on top.

Me no luv  Luv a Java Coffee House.
author: Sara L.

description:
I just moved into the area from Los Angeles, and i have to admit I rather enjoy the quiet tiny cafe atmosphere, something you don't really get in LA.  There's nothing fancy about Luv a Java, which is what makes it so good, although I really want to take one of their backgammon boards.

Coffee, Wifi, bagels, and power outlets.  Oh ya and great service.  What more could you ask for in a neighborhood coffee shop?
author: Nathan P.

description:
Update: A few months ago I had to take my luvajava down a couple of stars because of a change in counter folks, but things are back to normal, which in this case is great, and so all my stars are back!

This place is such a rarity - a truly unpretensious place with great coffee, an inexpensive fruit salad, and free WIFI. The women who work the counter in the morning when I stop by are really nice and down to earth and the customers are a nice mix - the work crews from Dolores Street, work-from-home/cafe types, neighborhood parents. I get an Americano, fruit cup, and zucchini muffin and am good to go.
I know that Martha's gets many more regulars up the street, but I now can't stand the service and grainy mochas after trying Luv a Java.
author: Casey W.

description: This place was a gem in around the corner from the place I stayed in Noe Valley.  It had free wfii, an abundance of breakfast pastry and egg sandwich choices, great coffee and large glorious sunshine filled windows.  Thanks for the coffee ladies!  I would definitely return if I was in the neighborhood again.
author: Lauren L.

description: Luv luv luv luv a Java! My husband (at the time was my boyfriend) used to go here everyday when he would visit me at my place. He always bragged about their coffee & food. They get an entire star for having hummus which I love on my bagel so it makes me happy to have something other than cream cheese to spread on my bread. The place is cute, cozy, never crowded & the perfect place to get on your laptop or read a book with your cup-o-joe.
author: Ashlee F.

description: Really good coffee, great food and amazingly friendly service. Perfect for my morning coffee during the week, comfortable place to work when I'm not in the office, and a great place to get a bite for breakfast or lunch.
author: Kirsten S.

description:
I always try to stop for a coffee when I am heading for 280 and the peninsula. This place delivers perhaps the most consistently excellent cuppa joe in town. (Well - that's a doubleTallNonFatLatte, actually, thank you very much!)

It's a bright and breezy location, with interesting artwork and very pleasant baristas to pass the time while you wait for your next caffeine fix.

They have a 5-minute parking space out front on Dolores - 5 minutes that people actually seem to honor, so, if the space is taken, just hang a turn at the next right, come around the block, and the space is most likely going to be free and waiting for you when you come back around!

It's worth it - it's the best... every time.
author: Kingpin X.

description:
Luv-A-Java is the Noe Valley coffee shop I head to when seeking solitude rather than human interaction.  Come the rainy season, it's my go-to spot when inclement weather displaces the outdoor bench scene at Martha's on 24th Street.

While peaceful, it's not terribly chatty.  Whenever I cozy up to a window spot and kick back at Luv-a-Java, I do so knowing that a solitary visit sits ahead of me, but also  *knowing* that my paper will get read, and *knowing* that the crossword puzzle  will get my best effort.  Martha's on 24th Street is polar opposite...conversation is quick and easy, but you never know when one of the locals is going to get ahold of your ear and start going yakyakyakyakyak a mile a minute, leaving little if any chance of your newspaper getting a quick glance let alone a solid read.  Regular customers interact with the staff while ordering, but conversation at the tables is scarce.  The music is coffee-shop appropriate, but just a tad loud. Barking dogs on the sidewalk are rare, and screaming children are all but non-existent.

Newspaper readers gravitate towards the front, where small tables bask in natural lighting that cascades in through large windows facing Dolores and 26th Streets.  Free wireless Internet brings in laptop users, who usually cluster towards a cozy area at the rear featuring subdued, LCD friendly lighting.  Better yet, multiple power outlets placed in useful spots let the home-office crowd hang out with their laptops without worrying about battery life. 

Quiet. Peaceful. Solitary. A light, airy space with good coffee and ample snacks.  A good spot to lose oneself in a newspaper or work away from home, but not so great for catching the latest neighborhood gossip.  Looking to get away from it all rather than wallow with the masses?  Pop by, grab a cup, and postpone life's demands for an hour or two...
author: Mike W.

description:
My boyfriend and I affectionately call this place "Mom and Pop's" because of the sweet folks who work there.  He prefers Martha Bro's for a more potent cup, but I'll choose the relaxed vibe at Luv a Java any day over long, crowded lines at Martha's.

I'll echo Kingpin X's comments about it being a great place to swing by on your way to 280.  Their extra foamy lattes make the daily trek down to Palo Alto that much easier.  

Also, their Greek salad makes for a great quick lunch if you need it.
author: Rosanna O.

description: I love this cafe.  I stop here regularly for a latte and bagel.  It's surprisingly difficult to find a place that has both good cafe, AND will toast a good-quality bagel and slap some cream cheese on it for you.  The ladies who run are always lovely and efficient, and it feels great to support a local, independent coffee place.
author: Marina C.

description:
A really fantastic coffee shop.  Their top selling points for me are 

**quiet**
**clean**
and
**free wifi**

although their simple but delightfully tasty iced tea and iced coffee (to me, the mark of a good coffee place is not messing up iced coffee) don't hurt.
author: tara w.

description:
wow! what a great little coffee joint! i wish i could have had something like this in santa cruz during my college days!

this place is quaint with really friendly service and REALLY nice customers who go there. every one was polite and shared the space with their neighbors! it was so surreal! and even though i only stopped by on the way from home to grab a macchiato, they made me wish i had some book to read or school work to do just so i can stay and enjoy the ambiance!

OH! and their macchiato was great too! only boohoo about this place is the parking. =[
author: amelia g.

description: A real nice place to chillax at.  I ordered a 16 oz. hot chocolate and bought a slice of chocolate marble cake and a slice of pound bread.  The gal who rang me up was very nice and had a cool tat of her cat.  I sat by the table in front of the drink frig.  I was relaxed and was able to nibble on the chocolate and sip my hot cocoa while knitting in public to celebrate I Love Yarn day today.  At least five other tables were occupied and ppl trickled in and out for coffee and lunch.  I would come back again and try out one of their sammies.
author: Kekumukula N.

description:
I enjoyed the mulitple times that Ive had a 2ble capp. here.
You can also get a (little) snack if you are on the go.
The place is more neighborhoody than mission-visitor strollers. They have a comfy couch and also an open space so you can people watch out the window or sit and read. I quite appreciate their openess in their space, makes it relaxing and welcome.
author: ninja M.

description:
A few nice plants, lots of books, interesting art make this little neighborhood cafe good overall.  Kinda small, about 8 tables, and often has kids in it ..

Wifi is free but needs password.

3/5 Coffee
4/5 Atmosphere
3/4 Service
4/5 Value
author: chad n.

description:
Note: this might not be a fair review.....

I have been romanticising about falling in love with this coffee shop since I moved to Noe Valley a few years ago.  We walked by on our way home from taking our dog for a walk and stopped in for a quick coffee to go.

No sooner did we get in and I placed my order (specifying "to go") than the guy behind the counter told me to leave my dog outside.  I have no problem with that, but I did say to go, our dog is all of 10 pounds, it was really cold outside, and there is no sign anywhere saying "no dogs".  I went out and stood in the cold with the pup while my boyfriend finished the transaction and brought out our coffees.

Frankly, the coffee wasn't that good and I was just put off by the way I was asked to leave.  I highly doubt if I'll go back here again.
author: Kelly M.

description:
I had to update my review after they totally revamped their lunch menu.  So far I've tried the pastrami, falafel, greek salad and tuna salad.  They brought in a new person who made up the recipes and he rocks.  All for less than the deli I go to on 24th.  And the breakfast burrito is delicious big and delicious, awesome salsa.

Best latte's I've had in SF.  Much better than the stuff that comes out of Starbuck's machines.  This isn't a Mission cafe, outside of rotating art on the walls from local artists.  Mostly people who come in to chat, read or work on their computers.  Lots of tables, a couch and chairs.  The music is up to the employees' choice.  Very comfortable , relatively quiet and family/dog friendly, if that's what you're looking for.

Oh, and someone complained about the outside door in the bathroom, which they leave open on hot days to get more air-flow.  Ummmm, you can close it.  It's on hinges and that round thing with the button on it is a doorknob and a lock.  You can look up how it works on the Internet.
author: Rick A.

description:
VANILLA CHAI HERE WILL MAKE YOU NEVER DRINK COFFEE AGAIN BC COFFEE SUCKS ANYWAYS.

nice book selection  too xo
author: Lauren V.

description:
This is the only coffee shop I'll bother to review, because it's incomparable. I walk the extra blocks, past XO and Martha Bros. to patronize Luv a Java.

1. Best mocha I've ever had. Drop me a line if you've found better, and you better not say Martha's, Starbucks, Seattle's Best, Tully's or Peet's.
2. Try the blueberry bran muffin and tell me you've had better! It's a $1.65 and a meal unto itself.
3. Kindly service. The staff is very nice.
author: Griffin L.

description: This place is a gem. Consistently good lattes, fresh pastries and now they even have yummy sandwiches. Plenty of seating, reliable internet and friendly staff. They even have books to read while you are there! The owner is sincerely nice and helpful.
author: Azul C.

description:
In desperate need of coffee I was delighted when Google reported that my apartment is in very close proximity of a coffee shop. I sleepily walked over and got myself a huge cup of latte, admiring the full shelf of books for reading and purchase (w00t!) and the comfy couches. Walking out the door, I was already planning to Yelp this place with five stars, but realized that maybe I shouldn't let my withdrawal symptoms along with proximity to my apartment dictate my reviews. I should at least taste the coffee first, and take into account that not everyone in San Francisco is my roommate.

The latte could have had more bite to it and the milk could have been more frothed. But the ambiance was nice, the staff nice and helpful, so I'll be back to try the rest of the menu.
author: Lina M.

description:
This is a nice little neighborhood cafe with free WiFi. We occasionally come here to do work and usually kick back with a pot of tea (they have a really good multi-brand selection of teas, Mighty Leaf being the high end. I prefer this cafe to Martha's (which is a couple blocks closer to us) as it's far less chaotic and a nicer place to sit and have a quiet conversation or do some work. There's a wallful of books if you'd rather read, too. The staff has always been friendly.

Cons: food selection is kinda small (bagels and some pastries). They do have some nice fruit cups, too. Not only is the bathroom toilet tiny, it's unheated, and freezing on a cold day. Good thing I'm a man.
author: Andrew H.

description: Close and convenient to home.  Great neighborhood coffee shop that has a good selection of sandwiches and treats.  Friendly staff and yummy macaroons!!  Not the world's best coffee but definitely good enough to get your caffeine fix!!
author: Jessica P.

description:
What a lame name!  Well, these days every possible name is out there somewhere, so proprietors have to go trite.  The staff here are good people, always consistent with their early morning "hellos" and service.  The drip and espresso beverages are about equal in quality, I feel like they use a darker roast than most other places.  Good place to stop into in the morning if you are in the Mission and want to avoid Valencia and Mission streets due to parking issues.

If you dig bagels, they prepare tasty toasted ones with melted cream cheese.
author: TJ D.

description:
It was cool to meet the Barista who is a fellow Minnesotan! Go midwest!  

I really like this place; great chill atmosphere and good coffee.  I like the big front windows that let in a lot of light.  It's also nice being off the beaten path to have less traffic coming in and out when you're trying to relax.  

One bad thing, I don't I've had such a dry/crumbly cookie in a while.  Oh cookie, did you want to go in my mouth? No? No you just want to cumble when i touch you and get all over my clothes and table?  Okay. 

And Luv a Java is a terrible name.  Just sayin.
But I won't let that stop me from enjoying this great place and free wireless.
author: Levi B.

description:
---this coffee shop gets a a big fat george castanza sarcastic "EHHH" 
--why
---well its a good coffee shop. the coffee tastes good. 
---when i got interviewed here it was stressed that "the customer is always right", which if you have read my reviews i really don't agree with.
---customer "hey this macchiato is made wrong"
---I think to myself "is it worth it to ruin this persons day? should i break it to him that a macchiato is not what he thinks it is? am i one of those stuck up coffee shop asshole? were is the line between loving coffee so much that you wanna educate the public, and being a f-ing jerk asshole stuck up barista?"
----i say "oh OK, ill remake it STARBUCKS style"
---customer "your a dick"
---i say "well........ the customer is always right" 

ya so anyways
it seems like a pretty yuppish coffee shop. my only real problem with this is...........if i actually got the job (which i didn't, and no, I'm not bitter) i would have to listen to Sarah McLaughlin (or however you spell it) on some digital radio station all day. and YES that does ruin a coffee shop. 
but 
the boss Ruth is nice and if quiet jams and blended mocha-bagel-chinos are your thing then,,,,,,,,, this is your place.

-----oh ya also i don't like walking up a hill to join the rich folk, it just physically reminds me that I'm "poor folk" ......like if a big ass flood came us valley dwellers would die first.
author: jeff e.

description:
As someone who works out of coffee shops, Luv a Java was a great find.  I worked there for two hours, and only ordered a pot of tea.  The tea was standard, but the atmosphere was superior!  The coffee shop offered free wifi, and there were numerous outlets for laptops in the intimate space; the view of traffic on Dolores was oddly relaxing.  

I would definitely work here again in the future, only if I am looking for a short stint, however since I don't have a permit valid for the neighborhood.
author: Diana P.

description: This coffee shop had a great vibe to it.  The coffee was great and my networking friend told me they have a great turkey bagel but I must share that it was really a cool place to hang out.  I'm sure it has it's busy times, but Wednesday mid-morning was excellent.  It wasn't crowded and really noisy.  It was a good place to meet with a friend or to do some work or reading because you could actually concentrate.  (Some coffee shops that I've been in are just to noisy and distracting to get any work done.)  Parking was easy too.  I found a spot really close.  I'll be back to try the turkey bagel.
author: Brent T.

description: As the other reviewers point out, Luv a Java is a nice, quiet place set away from the bustle of 24th St, but still very much Noe.  And yep, lots of people in here with the paper and/or laptop.  Coffee and decor's pretty standard, though, so If you're not within walking distance, it's not really much of a destination.  Still, it just might be worth a special trip for their veggie bagel: a perfect balance of cream cheese, avocado, red onion, and cucumber that makes a great start to a sunny Saturday (and really, good bagel sandwiches aren't as trivial as they sound).  Anyway, it's pretty easy to stop in on your way to the Mission or the 280, or if you just need a moment to gear up for the Noe scene.
author: Wes M.

description:
Plusses: Very nice staff, mellow environment

Minuses: Spotty internet connection, lack of outlets to juice up your computer, small tables (suited for one person).

Great place to drink good coffee, and get some work done if you are alone.  But it is so quiet that chatting inside the cafe seems like a bit of a no-no.
author: Jane A.

description: Probably the only place so far im gonna order a 16 oz hot chocolate! So worth it!
author: Cavin T.

description: A very very good place to do work. Big tables to spread out my papers/laptop/crap. Several wireless networks. Thoughtful silent patrons who mostly go outside to speak on their phones. A generally studious quiet atmosphere, little music; there's even a shelf of books at the back. The bagels sandwiches are great. Unfortunately the drip coffee is terrible, and the limited pastry selection is from City Bakery (oversized flavorless bran muffins etc). I eat at home and come here to work.
author: Hannah S.

description: Gotta luv Luv a Java. Great little "no pressure" cafe with free wifi, good coffee and awesome Mediterranean treats. My go to place when I feel like getting out of the house and working from coffee shop.  Only problem is the couch area doesnt have a convenient place to plug in my laptop.
author: Mitali P.

description:
Quickly rising in the ranks of my Coffeeshops To Chillax In.  Very laidback, a few couches, a few tables.  My favorite: a wall of used books available for reading and purchase!  The awesome!

Try the cider - delicious and wintry!  Coffeeshop Guy even put a cinnamon stick in my to-go cup.  Awwww!
author: maisnon ..

description:
Luv A Java is the place I go when I really need to have a good cup of joe, put on the headphones, and get some quality work done.  It's my home-office away from my home-office.

The owners and staff are lovely and everyone has a nice vibe.  The coffee and espresso are delicious.  Kind of light on food, but what they have (always a tasty quiche and homemade sandwiches) is very good.

Did I mention FREE WIFI?  Love this place.
author: hillary h.

description: Nice hidden little coffee shop. Friendly staff and small selection of lunch foods. Good place for a lunch meeting.
author: jason h.

description:
This place is a great no-frills coffee shop -- prices are extremely reasonable, the staff is very friendly, and the coffee is delish!  Especially try the blended coffee drinks if you aren't calorie-counting... they are not -to-be missed.  They also have mini art/jewlery shows, which adds to the local-home-town feel.
We went here at 1 PM on a Sunday afternoon and there were tables available and our food and drinks were served quickly.  It's pretty small with limited seating though, so I can imagine during peak hours it might be difficult to get a seat.
author: Simmi M.

description: I was there yesterday, and they told me they closed at 6, couldn't finish my work, since I was using the computer, but they r listed that they closed at 7pm??....
author: Karen P.

description: This is a nice little cafe that is pretty quiet and a great place to work. Fre wifi and power outlets make it possible to work here for a nice long time, the seating is not very comfortable and is the weakest link. By no means is it a complaint or a deterrent. If you wanna grab a coffee and work/surf for a while, its plenty comfortable. I tend to be a squatter on occasion, so Id like to be the first to admit that this review needs to be read with a pich of brown sugar :)
author: Vivek N.

description: Nice little Wi-Fi enabled cafe that is pretty quiet, if your looking to catch up on some studying or work.  Not crowded like XO Cafe, Ritual or Martha's and they have a decent amount of seating.  I wasn't too impressed by the coffee or pastries and it's seems to lack a vibe.  But when your looking for wireless and a seat, you need to keep your options open!
author: Jason A.

description:
it's one of those sweet neighborhood joints. kinda like Cheers but without the drunks. you should go.
plus the coffee is the best.
the only thing better than the coffee is the staff! man they are great! they all deserve raises!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: If you are looking for great coffee, Luv a Java brews one of the best cups in the city.  The staff is friendly and the service is excellent.  While enjoying the free wi-fi, you can always count on a chill vibe to counteract the effects of the strong brew.  The location is conveniently located on the corner of 26th and Dolores.  Parking is fairly easy and you are just a couple of blocks from the Muni.
author: Wayne H.

description: You simply can not get better coffee in the city!  If you are in Noe or Dolores Mission, you would be fool to miss the coffee shop-cum-local art house!!!  The staff is home-brewed and the free wi fi makes it a great place to amp n chill!
author: Cari J.

description:
for a first time at a cafe can be hard, but with LUV A JAVA, it never disappointed me! let's see... that day (9/5), i was looking for a new cafe to take advantage of, and i saw this. my first reaction is this cafe is all the wayyy down at dolores, and the walk there can be challenging. BUT THE WALK IS WORTH IT BECAUSE IT'S GOOD FOR YOUR TOUCHE AND CALVES! hehehe..

about my experience, i just had an iced mocha and their italian chicken turnover. they're BOTH great, but what irked me is that you have to have a $5 minimum purchase on your credit/debit, and i was running low on my debit at that time. other than that, i liked that the cafe have a wall of books to read and buy, lots of outlets for the laptop, not much of a seating. there's this corner that has the couch and a couple of comfy seats (however you call them!) 

it wasn't bustling with people, but it was alright. i like that this cafe is a corner cafe, on a quiet street, and very quaint. LOL
i would go back for sure! hope you will too..
author: Marc K.

description: Cute neighborhood coffee shop. The decor and ambiance definitely leave something to be desired. They weren't too busy, so there was lots of available seating when I visited. Most of the other patrons were working on laptops, not a lot of groups gathering to hang out, so the place was extremely quiet for a coffee shop and work oriented. Weird music selection. The staff was really nice. The latte and veggie wrap I had were decent. Free wifi is a plus but it dropped once or twice. And the street parking around here isn't bad either.
author: kathy c.

description: Really, really nice people run this community coffee house.  But I like the coffee at Martha & Bros. more, so I haven't been in a while.
author: Andrew E.

description: A quiet, low-key cafe. It's the trusted place for me and my flavor-of-the-century boy to go to in the morning--he gets coffee, i get hot chocolate, we look at the blankets hanging on the walls, kiss outside on the corner of Dolores and 26th, then we go our separate ways. Free wi-fi is a sweet deal. The pastries aren't that spectacular, but the people there are always open to thoughts and comments, so I feel like I'm welcome there. :) A nice place to stop by if you want some peace and a friendly serving of coffee.
author: Josephine J.

description:
Luv Luv a Java

Unlike some of the reviewers below, I have always had wonderful interactions with the staff here, and the coffee has been perfect (I rarely stray from my soy latte so perhaps other beverages aren't quite as good?).

I happen to think the bathroom with its wall opening up into the alley an amusing quirk...peeing en plein air...tee hee.

The library is an added bonus - for my husband at least...he rarely comes out without a book in hand and our shelves are overflowing.  Ah well.

A great neighborhood coffee shop - perfect for a drive by en route to 280 or to sit down and wile away the hours.
author: Kate W.

description: Thank heavens I now have a place closeby to get a good cup of black coffee that's not Ritual. Free wifi.
author: R E.

description: Very homey, quiet cafe.  Felt very comfortable being there to use the free wifi, read, stare into space...not so much a place to chat though b/c like I said, it's quiet.  Ordered a tasty egg nog latte.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Superb little place that fits hand-in-glove with its quiet "Off 24th St" setting. They brew a killer cup of coffee, rich, deep flavored coffee that makes one proud to live in SF. Service is always cordial and attentive, and I think they really do want you to "have a nice day."
author: Travis W.

description:
My great discovery of the week...in fact, I am sitting here right now in the cafe!  Thanks to Yelpers and their reviews, I finally found this gem in my own neighborhood - seriously, I would have continued to overlook it, not realizing their was wireless, if not for the reviews.  Thanks Yelp!

Get this - my residence where I used to work has been over-run by obnoxiously raucous construction, and so I realized I might be forced to trying to be productive at cafes along Valencia or Mission St -- which aren't my ideal setting, considering the commotion and tight quarters.  Sooo a handy Yelp search produced this cafe, even closer to home.  I truly like it!!  It's not noisy - in fact, some people step outside to conduct their phone conversations so I wouldn't suggest coming here for a lively debate with a group or such.  There's also enough space.  While I am working, I peer upon luscious palm trees.  I feel very comfy here!  The people who work here are rather nice and helpful.  And, oh, most importantly, the coffee's nice and brisk and rocks me to the core.  And, hey, I don't know what is meant about there being no food, because there are plenty of nibblies here, though most are ready-made.  I had a nice greek salad for lunch and I can see there are  some pre-made sandwiches here too.
author: Femita J.

description: Update: After re-checking my statement today, the amount charged had been corrected. So..maybe it was a mistake? Or maybe they read my review...? In any case, at least it was corrected..
author: SL N.

description: Awful coffee. Seriously bad. Gave it two tries (second out of pure convenience), and both failed to impress me miserably. I actually left wondering the second time how people can run a coffee shop and seemingly have not one care how their product tastes. I'm thinking the answer has something to do with people's utter desperation for the stuff.
author: sarahjane s.

description: Support this place! it's never busy enough - go buy things there. Casual staff, free wi-fi. The could use a few more treats though. Man does not live by liquid alone.
author: hunter w.

description: Great place wonderful coffee and wow bagels,  I have the bagel with turkey and cheese yum this place rocks.  The iced coffee with fat free milk is yummy.  If I could add stars I would the guys and gals that work there are great they are the nicest ppl in any coffee shop I have ever been to all of them are consistantly nice you guys rock!!!!!
author: julie c.

description: A library for browsing, coffee for drinking and a Northbound hill for climbing. Took home some organic beans and wasn't overly impressed. Tough competition and low accessibility. Does make the organic list, though.
author: paul c.

description: Great coffee. Tiny bit expensive. Good bagels and cream cheese. A great 'hood cafe.
author: Rashmi V.

description: Quiet little cafe, with free wifi, good coffee, and tons of books to read or buy. Not much in the way of eats though. http://www.luvajava.com/
author: Stuart J.

description: Not a favorite.  The coffee is acceptable, not exceptional.  Overall, I was bored with the place.  I'm trying to decide if I prefer the hipsters at Ritual, probably not, but they have something they are going for, whereas this place is "generic cafe that sells books."
author: John D.

description:
i like this place- to go and get some work done while listening to music and using free wifi. the best soy vanilla latte i've ever had. i don't know the girl's name that makes it but it is dreamy.

good bagel sammies too
author: ms.kiki g.

description: I used to love this place and get lots of grad school work done there. Now--at least during the weekday--the staff is different and sucky. They blast bad music when the customers are 100% all about work. They're not nice either, which I don't care about so much, but having someone cough all over my food before handing it to me defintiely makes me want to stay away...
author: martie j.

description: i luv luv a java.  it is quiet and friendly.  their iced mochas leave a lot to be desired, but their lattes are fantastic and the coffee is pretty good too.  well worth the trip up the hill, luv a java is the sort of place you root for.  you want them to do well.  i really enjoy that i can just sit here for an hour, nurse my latte and read my book.  the wifi and all that is nice too, but i'm a pen and paper kinda gal and i like that i don't feel out of place without a laptop.
author: Samantha W.

description: the people who work here are SOOO super nice. like, i actually find myself wondering how they are doing, what they've been up to, how are their families, what are their summer plans?  i mean, it's a little bizarre. and i only met them once. and by met, i mean, she rang up my order, he handed me a drink, and half a minute later, he gave me soy milk to put in my drink. they both waved when i left, but that was only because i waved first. and, again, they were probably just being nice. i want all of my days to start off like that. it's like sesame street for adults. brought to you by the letter N as in nice and the number 1.
author: julia r.

description:
i read the other reviews and was excited to go here; maybe i went at a wrong time (about 10 am), but this place was not very good.  the coffee was decent.  the tables were awkward, and everyone was on their computer.  the windows didn't open, and it was terribly hot.  it was an uncomfortable scene.

maybe it would be better at night?
author: Christopher H.

description: This place is so adorable. Pretty quiet atmosphere but its a wonderful little neighborhood coffee shop. The girl who was helping my friend and I was SO helpful and nice! I really recommend this place!
author: Kendal B.

description: Free WiFi and lot's of power outlets!  The coffee isn't bad, either.  The baristas have been friendly to me and remember me after only a couple of visits.  They asked if I liked my mocha and/or if they could make it better for me (hard to get the strength factor just right on an iced mocha).  They also have a big bookshelf with books you can browse through or buy.  I just wish they had outdoor seating.
author: K V.

description: The best cafe for miles (though, to be fair, it's just blocks from my place...).  Comfy, clean (in stark contrast to the Muddy Waters of the world), always good music playing, a carefully selected bookcase of books for browsing -- even if you've no intention of buying -- and Abraham, the owner, is so nice.  The coffee is really good too.  Oh, and they have mini Ritter chocolates for sale, for when you just need that tiny morsel of sweet.
author: Juan d.

description: Favourite Noe Valley cafe hands down, and likely to be in the top 5 for those in San Francisco. Has that 'hole in the wall' look, that made me think I found a hidden neighbourhood gem. An optimal place to bring one's lap-top or a good book and idle away a few hours. The staff and owner seem uber cool with this, and it adds to the chill atmosphere of the place. Coffee is great and strong, pastries fine, and there's a good selection of other drinks to buy. The only caveat is that because it's so quiet during the late morning / afternoon, it's not really ideal for a raucous conversation between friends. That said, I love introducing the place to friends visiting the area as it's my ideal place for a coffee and a good read.
author: Steven B.

description: This is an awesome place, hip and all. Luv the java specially the Soy Mocha. Utterly incredible.
author: Abu A.

description: This place is probably a 3 and a half star blaster but I'm rounding up.  Everything I've experienced here is decent or better but I'm not a fan of getting take out cups when i order an item "for here".  There's some ambiance and a great selection of books to borrow or buy.
author: pauline e.

description: my favorite work cafe. good coffee, nice tables/seating, lots of power outlets, usually tolerable music, and fast free wifi. i can spend hours here. bonus points for the use of spoons for stirring coffee, instead of disposables.
author: Ben H.
